meanings.sent1: The soup had a saltish flavor that reminded me of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The popcorn was just the right amount of saltish for my liking.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her cooking was so saltish, it could make a sailor thirsty.
meanings.sent4: The air near the beach was filled with a saltish tang that tickled my nose.
meanings.sent5: The chips were so saltish that I couldn't stop eating them.

meanings.definition: Having a slight taste of salt.
meanings.sent1: The crackers had a subtle saltish hint that complemented the cheese.
meanings.sent2: The salad dressing was a bit too saltish for my taste.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a saltish touch to the dish, making it unique.
meanings.sent4: The tears on her cheeks left a saltish trail as she cried.
meanings.sent5: The sea breeze carried a refreshing, saltish scent.

meanings.sent1: The mineral water had a strange, saltish aftertaste.
meanings.sent2: The sauce had a peculiarly saltish flavor that surprised me.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a saltish twist that made it stand out.
meanings.sent4: The dish had a saltish undertone that added depth to the flavors.
meanings.sent5: The soup had a rich, saltish broth that warmed me up.
